meanings.definition: One who compels or forces someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The compeller made the student study harder for the test.
meanings.sent2: The strict teacher was a compeller of good behavior in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The compeller of vegetables made sure everyone ate their greens.
meanings.sent4: The compeller of time urged everyone to be punctual.
meanings.sent5: The compeller of kindness encouraged people to be compassionate.

meanings.definition: Something that compels or forces someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The looming deadline acted as a compeller for the team to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: Fear can be a powerful compeller in decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies was a compeller for the children to come inside.
meanings.sent4: The sound of thunder was a compeller for the dog to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message served as a compeller for immediate action.
